solution_line_template: Then find how many students in Ms. Perez's class collected 12 cans each: {total_students} students / {half_divisor} = <<{total_students}/{half_divisor}={students_collected_12_cans}>>{students_collected_12_cans} students

Then find how many cans the students who collected 12 cans each collected in total: {students_collected_12_cans} students * {cans_per_student_12} cans/student = <<{cans_per_student_12}*{students_collected_12_cans}={total_cans_from_12_can_collectors}>>{total_cans_from_12_can_collectors} cans

Then find how many cans the students who collected 4 cans each collected in total: {remaining_students} students * {cans_per_student_4} cans/student = <<{cans_per_student_4}*{remaining_students}={total_cans_from_4_can_collectors}>>{total_cans_from_4_can_collectors} cans

Then add both amounts of cans to find the total: {total_cans_from_12_can_collectors} cans + {total_cans_from_4_can_collectors} cans = <<{total_cans_from_12_can_collectors}+{total_cans_from_4_can_collectors}={total_cans_collected}>>{total_cans_collected} cans
